text:
Hi Dave, why is Insights QE closed source?  At today's MBU all-hands meeting it was stated that Insights is "given away for free" to increase the value of RHEL, and even a 10% revenue increase of RHEL would dwarf any Insights sales.

I recently joined the Koku team as a software engineer and was hoping to learn more.
hey Nick, QE has been told by Paul Cormier not to opensource the test automation... its our value add to the subscription and is something that differentiates us from other vendors
and Insights is definitely given away for free as part of a paid for subscription but the majority of the platform and its services are not opensource at this time
Is the rest of Red Hat product
sorry, wasn't done with that sentence..
Are the rest of Red Hat's product's test automation also closed source? For example, RHEL, OpenShift, Storage, etc.
I believe it varies...  products that are more community based do share more of that test code than others that don;t have such community involvement
